tasks.task: Grow chili peppers indoors and outdoors.
subtasks: Soak seeds in water for 24 hours.
Place seeds on a moist paper towel or peat pellet.
Place seeds in a warm location or plastic bag for 2 weeks.
Transfer indoor seedlings to a warm windowsill or grow box.
Acclimate outdoor seedlings to outdoor conditions over 7-10 days.
Transplant to well-prepared beds with fertile, moist, well-drained soil.
Move indoor plants to larger containers as they grow.
Prune flowering shoots by removing the growing tip.
Apply organic high nitrogen fertilizer after pruning.
Harvest peppers when ripe, whether green or colored.
